DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: New primary malignant neoplasm derived from cells that are capable of forming melanin._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._Something that happens at a given place and time._Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Having no previous example or precedent or parallel; of a kind not seen before.:An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:A primary melanoma arising from atypical melanocytes in the skin. Precursor lesions include acquired and congenital melanocytic nevi, and dysplastic nevi. Several histologic variants have been recognized, including superficial spreading melanoma, acral lentiginous melanoma, nodular melanoma, and lentigo maligna melanoma.

Concepts.definition: Having no previous example or precedent or parallel; of a kind not seen before.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.

A primary melanoma arising from atypical melanocytes in the skin.  Precursor lesions include acquired and congenital melanocytic nevi, and dysplastic nevi.  Several histologic variants have been recognized, including superficial spreading melanoma, acral lentiginous melanoma, nodular melanoma, and lentigo maligna melanoma.

Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
